snippet: Before the Labor Department releases its jobs report for May on Friday, there are already signs that the economy is moving in a better direction.
abstract: Commerce Dept says total April exports of $193.3 billion and imports of $240.6 billion resulted in goods and services deficit of $47.2 billion, hitting two-year high and up from revised $44.2 billion in March; numbers, along with other released statistics, indicate upswing in business activity and expectations for greater spending in months ahead.
lead_paragraph: Before the Labor Department releases its jobs report for May on Friday, there are already signs that the economy is moving in a better direction.

headline.main: Data Readings Converge to Show an Economy Regaining Momentum
headline.print_headline: Data Readings Converge to Show an Economy Regaining Momentum
